intro: Cyphia reducta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved cyphia, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sclerophyllous forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Cyphia reducta is known for its compact growth habit and is often found in coastal and inland areas with a Mediterranean climate. It plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for native pollinators.
